intro: Bostrychanthera yaoshanensis, commonly known as the Yaoshan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in cool, moist environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
